Press and outreach

A collection of our media coverage and outreach efforts

2019

These overlooked global diseases take a turn under the microscope

Faculty at the School of Veterinary Medicine target neglected tropical diseases with advanced science, cross-disciplinary collaborations, and work in the lab and the field.

Predicting treatment outcome for leishmaniasis

Nice write-up of our collaborative work on leishmaniasis.

The diet-microbiome connection in inflammatory bowel disease

A nice feature of our canine IBD study.

Demystifying genomic technology for veterinary researchers

The 5 year anniversary of CHMI.

Knowledge@Wharton on SiriusXM Radio

Interviewed with Max Perelman (Biomeme) on the future of veterinary diagnostics. 30min on air with 600,000 weekly listeners.

2018

Data From Largest Global Diarrheal Disease Study Available to Scientists on Public Sites

A feature that highlights new enteric disease datasets released on microbiomeDB.

2016

Penn Vet launches new platform to accelerate microbiome research

An article talking about the debut of our MicrobiomeDB project.

Can clinical trials on dogs and cats help people?

Science article that makes a shout out to our canine IBD study.

TEDx talk on the microbiome.

The Peddie School in Heightstown, NJ.

2015

Seed grants to support microbiome research

A feature on our efforts to support PennVet research through pilot grants

PennVet OneHealth Interview.

A video on ‘one-health’ produced by PennVet. Discusses some of our work in this area.

2014

Penn symposium to tackle microbes in health and disease

Announcing our annual microbiome symposium jointly hosted with PennVet, PennMed and CHOP

NBC10 interview on infectious diseases.

Live TV interview on NBC10 during the height of the 2014 Ebola outbreak. 7 minutes on air with 54,000 viewers.
